Module io.github.ascopes.jct
Package io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers.impl

Class JctFileManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers.impl.JctFileManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
JctFileManager, Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable, JavaFileManager, OptionChecker
@API(since="0.0.1", status=INTERNAL) public final class JctFileManagerImpl extends Object implements JctFileManager
Simple implementation of a JctFileManager.
Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Ashley Scopes

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • addPath

      public void addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, PathWrapper pathWrapper)
      Description copied from interface: JctFileManager
      Add a path to a given location.

      If the file manager is closed, this will raise an exception.

      Specified by:
      addPath in interface JctFileManager
      Parameters:
      location - the location to use.
      pathWrapper - the path to add.

    • ensureEmptyLocationExists

      public void ensureEmptyLocationExists(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Description copied from interface: JctFileManager
      Register an empty container for the given location to indicate to the compiler that the feature exists, but has no configured paths.

      This is needed to coerce the behaviour for annotation processing in some cases.

      If the location already exists, then do not do anything.

      Specified by:
      ensureEmptyLocationExists in interface JctFileManager
      Parameters:
      location - the location to apply an empty container for.

      @Nullable public @Nullable PackageContainerGroup getPackageContainerGroup(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Description copied from interface: JctFileManager
      Get the container group for the given package-oriented location.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Specified by:
      getPackageContainerGroup in interface JctFileManager
      Parameters:

      Returns:

      public boolean isClosed()
      Description copied from interface: JctFileManager
      Determine if the JavaFileManager.close() method has been called on this file manager or not.

      Specified by:

      Returns:
